channel.title: Complete NOOB 'Project Insanity'Guide + Tips to making a good RSPS
channel.description:
~
[b]Recommended tools that you should have before you consider proceeding:[/b] [url=http://"http://notepad-plus-plus.org/download/v5.9.3.html"]NotePad++[/url] [url=http://"http://www.rarlab.com/download.htm"]WinRar[/url] [url=http://"http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk-6u26-download-400750.html"]Java JDK[/url] [url=http://"http://www.java.com/en/download/chrome.jsp?locale=en"]Java[/url] Co-ordinates (custom made by me) Item ID list NPC ID list Original 'Project Insanity' + All dupes fixed - [url=http://uppit.com/vyfb1kcacppy/2._Client.rar]CLIENT[/url] - [url=http://"http://www.mediafire.com/?3yz87utdr5o5yz8"]SERVER[/url] -
[b]Guide Legend[/b] -Introduction -Changing Stating Location -Changing Starting Package -Spawning NPC's -Adding Shops -How to add NPC drops and change drop-rates -How to change Prices -Changing XP Rate -Changing the Max skill level from 99 -Enabling/disabling Administrator's from trading, selling or dropping any item -How to make various Commands *Teleportation commands *Item Commands *How to add player rights to commands -TIPS
[b]-Introduction[/b] (Skip if needed) Does you 'Favourites' bar look like this? [img]http://i723.photobucket.com/albums/ww237/Zezamu6/Untitled.png[/img] Crowded with multiple guides that are an absolute nessesity to your Project Insanity developments? Would it be a shit load more simple if they were all compiled and easy to read and follow? Well lucky for you, you have come to the right place... This guide will in fact include many guides that have already been posted multiple times in the past and no doubt the future, but this guide differs from all of those one hit wonders by having everything you could possibly need all-in-one!
[b]-Changing the Starting location[/b] Possibly One of the Two main things that attract first time users to your server, your starting zone should be vibrant & welcoming to users, it should be the hub of your server, containing the many things that your players require, so make sure you choose a nice and large area that should be able to contain things like shops & portals, so basically the general HUB of your server!
[i]Location of were new players log-in for the first time[/i] 1. To get started, you will want to open up your server folder and look for [b]config.java[/b], and open it. 2. Press Control+F and search for: [CODE]public static final int START_LOCATION_X = #### //Defult Starting Location public static final int START_LOCATION_Y = ####[/CODE] 3. Change the [b]####[/b] with the [b]X[/b] and [b]Y[/b] co-ordinates of your desired Home co-ordinates
[i]Location of were players spawn if they die[/i] 1. Open up your server folder and look for [b]config.java[/b], and open it. 2. Search for: [CODE] public static final int RESPAWN_X = [/CODE] There you will see two lines of code like this: [CODE] public static final int RESPAWN_X = #### public static final int RESPAWN_Y = #### [/CODE] 3. Change [b]####[/b] With the co-ordinates of your death spawn location
[b]How to change the Home Teleport (Spell book)[/b] Does you home teleport take you to a location other than 'your' home spot? A simple fix will solve that problem :)
1. Open up your server folder and look for [b]config.java[/b], and open it. 2. Search for this line: [CODE] public static final int LUMBY_X = [/CODE] There you will see two lines that look like this: [CODE] public static final int LUMBY_X = #### public static final int LUMBY_Y = #### [/CODE] 3. Change [b]####[/b] with the [b]X[/b] & [b]Y[/b] co-ordinates of your home location.
[b]-Changing Starting Package[/b] Maybe the second most important aspect to getting your new players interested in your server is the humble starter pack, I say this because it is what give's your players the tools needed to gain levels, earn money etc... The starter package should contain the bear minimums without it becoming too much of a challenge for players to earn Gold, or too valuable in which you will get people repeatability drop-trading the riches and what-not...
1. First you are going to want to open up your server folder and search for your [b]PlayerAssistant.java[/b], and open it. 2. Press Control+F and search for: [CODE]public void addStarter() {[/CODE] You will see something like this underneath it [CODE] c.getItems().addItem(995,5000000); c.getItems().addItem(1731, 1); c.getItems().addItem(554,600); c.getItems().addItem(555,600); c.getItems().addItem(556,600); c.getItems().addItem(558,1800); c.getItems().addItem(1381,1); c.getItems().addItem(1323,1); c.getItems().addItem(841,1); c.getItems().addItem(882,1000); c.getItems().addItem(380,500); }[/CODE]
Here is a basic explanation: [CODE]c.getItems().addItem(##,####);[/CODE] [b]##[/b]= Item ID [b]####[/b]= Amount of that Item
[b]-Spawning NPC's[/b] NPC's are the backbone of any RSPS, with out them, the game would only consist of skilling and would be rather boring. So lets get Started...
1. Open up your server folder and search for [b]spawn-config.CFG[/b], and open it. 2. You will see a whole line of codes similar to this [CODE] // npc spawnX spawnY height walk maxhit attack defence description //Bosses spawn = 2881 2907 4445 0 1 38 500 200 Supreme spawn = 2882 2915 4456 0 1 67 500 200 Prime spawn = 2883 2922 4444 0 1 36 500 100 Rex spawn = 3200 3275 3914 0 1 40 450 550 Chaos Ele spawn = 50 2271 4698 0 1 25 500 350 King Black Dragon [ENDOFSPAWNLIST] [/CODE] (Maybe not as tidy, but similar.)
Explination [CODE] // npc spawnX spawnY height walk maxhit attack defence description spawn = 2881 X Cord Y Cord 0=Ground 1=walks/0=Still Maxhit att Lv. def Lv. " " [ENDOFSPAWNLIST] [/CODE]
[CODE] height walk 0= Ground level 0= Can't walk 1+= Goin up levels 1= Can walk [/CODE]
3. Too add a NPC, just work off the explanations given to you.
[b]-Adding Shops[/b] Adding shops to your server is vital to it's economy by supplying players with the equipment they need to thrive on your server, while it could also be the worst thing to it if you start adding rare's to a shop, so don't go to over board. [QUOTE]e.g keeping 'rares' as monster drops[/QUOTE]
1. Open up your server folder and search for [b]ActionHandler.java[/b], and open it. 2. Press cotrol+F and search for: [CODE] case 683: [/CODE] And under it add [CODE]case ##: c.getShops().openShop(####);[/CODE] Explination [b]##[/b] = The NPC ID of the Shopkeeper [b]####[/b] = The Shop ID that will be used in [i]shops.cfg[/i] (make sure that this number is unique or you will get some errors!)
3. Open up your server folder and search for [b]Shops.cfg[/b], and open it. 2. You will see lines of code similar to this [CODE] //-----ShopID---ShopName--------------------------------Sell----Buy-----Item----Amount--Item----Amount shop = 1 General_Store 1 1 590 100 1755 100 shop = 2 Aubury's_Magic_Store 2 2 554 50000 555 500000 [/CODE] Explination [CODE] //-----ShopID-----------ShopName------------------------Sell----Buy-----Item------------Amount shop = Your shop ID SHOP_Name ## ## Item ID amount of that item [/CODE] [b]##[/b] = Change to 1 to only buy and sell what the shop has stocked - Change to 2 to buy and sell anything!
-How to add NPC drops and change drop-rates Have you found that your NPC's are not dropping an item too regularly, too often or not at all? Just follow these simple steps to change all that!
1. Open up your server folder and search for [b]NPCDrops.TSM[/b], and open it. (remember to right click and select edit!) 2. You will see lines of code like this: [CODE] #Man drops 1:1 995:100 554:100 #Guard drops 9:1 995:200 555:100 #general graardor 2550:40 829:1 391:2 385:2 564:50 1249:1 3052:3 892:75 1303:1 11712:1 11728:1 11714:1 11724:1 11704:1 11710:1 #sergeant grimspike 2551:100 995:50000 1303:1 385:2 3024:3 564:75 3052:3 11728:1 11710:1 11724:1 11712:1 11726:1 11714:1 11714:1 11710:1 11712:1 [/CODE] Explanation. [CODE] #NPC NAME here ####:## ####:## ####:## ####:## ####:## ####:## [/CODE] #### = Item ID you want to be dropped ## = The rate of which the item is dropped 3. So just change it as stated above and you should be fine.
[b]-How to change Prices[/b] Having the power to change the prices of items plays a big part in your server, you wouldn't want to play a server were the prices are jacked up high[QUOTE] e.g Rune Platebody = 100K, neither would you want to play a server were they are only 1k each.[/QUOTE]
1. Open your server folder and search for [b]prices.txt[/b], and open. 2. You will see lines and lines of numbers like this: [CODE] 0 1 1 1 2 5 3 1 4 5 5 10 6 187500 7 187500 8 187500 9 187500 [/CODE] Explanation The numbers on the left column correspond to the item ID while the numbers on the right column correspond to the price of that item 3. So as explained above, search for your item ID then change the price of that item via the right hand column
[b]-Adding/Changing Global Objects[/b] *TO BE ADDED
[b]-Changing XP Rate[/b] The XP rate on a server can make or break a player, whether it is because it was to difficult/easy for him or her to level up, because just like in RuneScape gaining the max skill is an accomplishment, an idea length of time taken to get say 99 should be around about 1-7 day's, I'll leave it up to you to figure out a nice rate.
[i]Combat[/i] 1. Open up your server folder and search for config.java, and open. 2. There you will need to search for: [CODE] public static final int MELEE_EXP_RATE = [/CODE] You will see these Three lines [CODE] public static final int MELEE_EXP_RATE = ####; // damage * exp rate public static final int RANGE_EXP_RATE = ####; public static final int MAGIC_EXP_RATE = ####; [/CODE] 3. Change #### to the rate you wish to gain XP at (I hit damage = XP that you set)
[i]Skill's[/i] 1. Open up your server folder and search for config.java, and open it. 2. Press control+F and search for: [CODE] public static final int WOODCUTTING_EXPERIENCE = [/CODE] You will see some lines of code like this [CODE] public static final int WOODCUTTING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int MINING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int SMITHING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int FARMING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int FIREMAKING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int FISHING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int AGILITY_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int PRAYER_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int RUNECRAFTING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int CRAFTING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int THIEVING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int SLAYER_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int COOKING_EXPERIENCE = ####; public static final int FLETCHING_EXPERIENCE = ####; [/CODE] 3. Change [b]####[/b] to the rate you wish to gain XP at (Decrease to make harder, Increase to make easier)
[b]-Changing the Max skill level from 99[/b] Is gaining level 99 in your skills seem a bit too low or easy? You can amp up the game by super-charging you players with higher skill ability's to either flaunt off, 0wn up or to gain access to secret content that is only accessible at it's highest peaks!
1. Open up your server folder and search for [b]PlayerAssistant.java[/b], and open it 2. Press control+F and search for: [CODE] public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { [/CODE] You will see this below [CODE] public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (exp > ####) return ##; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= ##; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 0; } [/CODE] 3. Change the [b]#[/b]'s to what it says in the below sentence... #[b]#[/b] = The value you would like your max level to be (135 is the un-confirmed max value) [b]####[/b] = The value you would like the amount of XP needed to gain that level (2,147,483,647 is the max number stored in a 32-bit signed integer) 4. While still in your server files, search for [b]player.java[/b], and open it. 5.Press Control+F and search for: [CODE] public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { [/CODE] And under that you should see: [CODE] public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0;
for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= ##; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0)); output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) return lvl; } return ##; } [/CODE] 6. Change [b]##[/b] With your max level you entered on [b]step 3[/b]
[b]-Enabling/disabling Administrator's from trading, selling or dropping any item[/b] If you have any valuable items in a Admin only shop, or if they are getting an unfair advantage to normal player and you cannot trust them to not ruin your servers ecconnomy, this may be the thing for you
1. Open up your server folder and search for [b]config.java[/b], and open it. 2. Search for this line: [CODE] static final boolean ADMIN_CAN_TRADE = [/CODE] You should see 3+ Lines that look like this [CODE] public static final boolean ADMIN_CAN_TRADE = #### public static final boolean ADMIN_CAN_SELL_ITEMS = #### public static final boolean ADMIN_DROP_ITEMS = #### [/CODE] Explination. [b]####[/b] will either be [i]true[/i] or [i]false[/i], meaning yes or no 3. Change [b]####[/b] to either [i]true[/i] or [i]false[/i]
[b]-How to make various Commands[/b] What is a private server without commands? Like literally one of the key aspects of what defines a private server, that and the easy skills and money :P So now I am going to show you the basic formats of the commands so you can start implementing them your selves!
[i]*Teleportation commands[/i] (My be hard to follow, so be warned!) 1. Open up your server folder and search for [b]commands.java[/b], and open it. 2. It shouldn't be too long to find it, but you should be looking for lines similar to this: [CODE] if (playerCommand.startsWith [/CODE] 3. Possibly a few lines under you should see a bracket like this [b]}[/b] And under the [b]}[/b] press [i]enter[/i] to make a new line, then add this line: (making sure you are keeping to the format) [CODE] if (playerCommand.equals("####")) { c.getPA().startTeleport(##, ##, 0, "modern"); } [/CODE] 4. Changed these values as so. [b]####[/b] = The name of your command (DO NOT put :: at the beginning, it will load it automatically) [b]##[/b] = The X & Y co-ordinate of your teleport destination
*[i]Give item commands[/i] (e.g Starter Packs, barrage runes etc...) 1. Open up your server folder and search for [b]commands.java[/b], and open it. 2. It shouldn't be too long to find it, but you should be looking for lines similar to this: [CODE] if (playerCommand.startsWith [/CODE] 3. Possibly a few lines under you should see a bracket like this [b]}[/b] And under the [b]}[/b] press [i]enter[/i] to make a new line, then add this line: (making sure you are keeping to the format) [CODE] if (playerCommand.startsWith("####") c.getItems().addItem(###, ##); c.getItems().addItem(555, 2000); c.getItems().addItem(556, 2000); c.getItems().addItem(557, 2000); [/CODE] 4. Change these values as so. [b]####[/b] = The name of your command (DO NOT put :: at the beginning, it will load it automatically) [b]###[/b] = Item ID [b]##[/b] = Amount of the item you wish to have (remember to input the ID as noted if it is a large amount of unstackerble items!)
[i]*how to add player rights to commands[/i] 1. Open up your server folder and search for [b]commands.java[/b], and open it. 2. Search for the command you wish to add a players right to e.g [CODE] if (playerCommand.startsWith("RANDOM") c.getItems().addItem(995, 1000) [/CODE] 3. Add this line [CODE] && c.playerRights >= ####) { [/CODE] To the end of your command like so: [CODE] if (playerCommand.startsWith("RANDOM") && c.playerRights >= ####) { c.getItems().addItem(995, 1000) [/CODE] 4. Replace [b]####[/b] with the player right e.g 0,1,2,3,4,5
[b]-TIPS[/b] * Always remember to compile either your Server and/or Client (depending on witch file was modified) via the [b]compiler.bat[/b] * I would suggest spending at least 1-2 weeks playing around with various sources that other players have made, these can be found in the [b]317 download section[/b] * I would suggest having some sort of brain on your shoulders, what I mean is, being rather good at mathematics & good'ish English skills * You are expected to blow up a few sources, but it's all part of your learning experience * If you are thinking about running/maintaining a good server, I would suggest reading through a java book e.g 'java for dummies' * If you are confident enough to edit values in your server the most resourceful files are your [b]client.java, config.java, CFG Folder[/b] etc * Always keep a back-up, I would suggest backing up your source after any major successful updates * To Find Item ID's, try looking in [b]item.cfg[/b] in the CFG file! (95% of the time, the ID's are incorrect) Portable Item ID list included with tutorial) * To Find NPC ID's, try looking in [b]NPC.cfg[/b] in the CFG folder! (95% of the time, the ID's are incorrect) Portable NPC ID list included with tutorial) *
[size=2em]I WOULD HAD ADDED MORE THINGS INTO THIS GUIDE, BUT RAN OUT OF ROOM... 2000 characters my ass.[/size]

Dude im a noob at coding, And this is an amazing thing to help me out thanks very much ! this will help me out alot!!! thank you! this probably had helped out alot of people like it did to me i did everything changed everything threw this easy to follow & everything damn thanks again! HAHA im sooo new at this coding crap im learning off you & everyone in this moparscape forums community!!! THANKS to EVERYONE. i don`t know why i havnt tryed this befor this is kinda fun for me some odd reason i like to know ill be making a server that people would play and have fun on Feels NICE

EDIT: Everything works fine besides some reason my home teleport wont change!! doesnt show errors when i compile but still doesnt work… thats messed up man ! or when i tryed to make ::home teleport that didnt work either i left out the :: but it still aint working !! this starting to bug me… gonna work on this and try to get it running thanks for all the help in your tutorial its helpful sure will help new comer coders
